title: Add missing `dns` binary to Docker image and bump version

labels.name: packaging
labels.description: Relating to build process or artifacts

title: Version bump for 0.10.0 release
Refactor `DnsClient` and introduce unit tests
body: Part of #107

title: Add TCP support to DNS client
body:
Add fallback to TCP for DNS client when the UDP message is trunctated.

Part of #107

title: Changelog and documentation updates
Read DNS settings from a resolv.conf file
body:
Allow some DNS settings to be read from a system's /etc/resolv.conf
file. Noteably, only the `nameserver` and a few `option`s are supported
for now. This change also switches resolution of A and AAAA names to
our DNS client instead of using the system resolver via `lookup_host`.


Part of #107

title: Allow DNS SRV records to be use to discover cache servers
body:
Adds support for discovering Memcached servers using DNS SRV records via the `dnssrv+` prefix on hostnames supplied for `mtop` and `mc`.

Part of #107

title: Update to latest version of cargo-dist
Implement a rudimentary DNS client for SRV record lookup
body:
This change creates a very basic DNS client capable of performing A, AAAA, CNAME, NS, SOA, TXT, and SRV types of queries. This is the first step in supporting DNS lookup of SRV records for service discovery in `mtop` and `mc`. It also adds a `dns` executable capable of making queries and parsing binary DNS messages.

This client has undergone very little testing and should be considered both experimental and internal to mtop.

See #107

title: Update default item TTL for `mc bench`

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

title: Dependency updates
Clean up client parsing logic to reduce duplication
Version bump for 0.9.0 release
Use unicode for finer grained gauges
Allow mtop theme to be set via CLI flag
body:
Allow color theme for the mtop UI to be set by the `--theme` flag. Available themes are "ansi", which uses only ANSI supported colors, "material", which uses a material color palette, and "tailwind", which uses a color palette based on tailwind CSS and is the default.

Fixes #123

title: Centralize UI in `theme` module and use tailwind palette
body:
Move the definition of the colors used in various mtop UI components to the `theme` module and create a few predefined themes. Currently, a dark theme using tailwind is the default. In the future different themes will be able to be selected.

Fixes #118

title: Avoid useless copies of fixture data in `mc bench`

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

title: Fix tab overflow from lots of hosts
body:
Allow all host tabs to be displayed even when there are more hosts than can fit on the screen. This fix is a bit of a cheat since we aren't actually moving the tabs, we just change the order of hosts based on user input. If this proves annoying to use we can look at actually moving the tabs around.

Fixes #117

title: Rename profiling module to avoid ambiguity
body: `mod pprof` was ambiguous in older versions of Rust since we were also referencing a dependency named `pprof`.

title: Improve release docs with step I always miss
Version bump for 0.8.0 release
Profiling support and performance improvements
body:
This change adds build-time support for collecting pprof profiling data when using the `mc` binary. Along with this, are a few performance improvements that came out of profiling.

* Don't do health checks on get or puts of connections by default. They're unnecessary most of the time and dramatically slow down benchmarks.
* Make the "score" used by rendezvous hashing simpler, just the hash of the server and key instead of taking the logarithm.
* Use a for-loop for scoring each server as part of server selection so that we don't compute the score for a particular server more than once.

Fixes #112

title: Add support for `mc bench` command to benchmark servers

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

body:
Add support for running simplistic benchmarks against a Memcached server. The purpose of the command is to provide an easy way to send _some_ amount of traffic to a server, not provide a comprehensive benchmark tool.

Fixes #109

title: Dependency updates
Use SocketAddr within Server abstraction
body:
Rework the way `Server` in the client works such that it wraps an address and server name instead of a string used for both connection and TLS name resolution. This change also indexes server-specific results (stats, meta, etc.) by ServerID instead of Server. ServerID is an opaque unique ID for a particular server.

Fixes #103

title: Fix PR number in changelog
Introduce high-level MemcachedClient
body:
Create a high-level client that interacts with multiple Memcached servers depending on the key or operation being performed. The client uses rendezvous hashing to determine which server is responsible for any relevant keys.

In addition the following improvements have been made:
* `Key` type introduced to validate keys before using them
* `mc` has been rewritten to clean up resources properly

The following things are missing and will done in follow up work:
* Tests for newly introduced client and hashing
* Type-safe alternative to string hostnames

title: Typos
Add support for incr/decr commands
Rename "internal" error type to "runtime"
Make key type for `Memcached::get` more generic
Validate keys and add support for add/replace commands
body: Validate keys for all methods that accept them and add support for the add/replace commands to the client along with corresponding `mc` commands.

title: Keep configurable number of connections to each server
body: Add configuration to the connection pool to allow a variable number of connections to each server to be kept in the pool, instead of a single connection to each one.

title: Update TLS related dependencies

Add help text for 'dns+' hostname prefix
Add a default 5 second timeout to mtop network operations
body:
Add a 5 second timeout to any network operations done by the `mtop` binary such as establishing connections or reading statistics from the server.

Fixes #89

Enable TCP_NODELAY on new TCP connections
body: Writes are buffered so there's no benefit to delaying sends in the hopes of avoiding lots of tiny packets.

Switch to "hash" crawler and avoid meta allocations
body:
Two independent changes to the client:
* Use the "hash" class when crawling all meta entries
* Avoid parsing key-value pairs we discard anyway

title: Perform health checks on clients when getting or putting them

Moves the UI into the `mtop` project/crate and the Memcached client into the `mtop-client` project/crate. Also upgrades some dependencies and fixes CLI flag validation with respect to TLS certs/keys.

Fixes #57

Spawn a new task to fetch stats from each server
body: Instead of fetching stats from each server in a loop, spawn a new future for each one and await them all at the end of the update task.

title: Add hostname to connection IO errors

body: In the stats update loop, log errors instead of returning early so that we get a chance to update status for each of the servers.
